titles.title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to provide a mandatory minimum prison sentence for certain wiretapping or electronic surveillance offenses by Federal officers or employees.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime.

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 11/7/1997--Introduced. Amends the Federal criminal code to set a mandatory minimum sentence of six months' imprisonment for any Federal officer or employee, acting under color of that office or employment, who commits an offense involving the interception or disclosure of wire, oral, or electronic communications.
